comment.author: 11418107@N02
comment._content: Jay Gould II married Anne Douglas Graham; she was the granddaughter of a Hawaiian native chiefess and a white American man from New York City. The Goulds married in 1911, and had three children before Jay II died in 1935. en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jay_Gould_II This was her mother, Eleanor Kaikilani Coney Graham Vos: en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Hubert_Vos_%281855-1935%29_-_K... Sarah (Sallie) Remsen Manice Mellon (1893-1954) was the daughter of William Manice, and wife of Charles Henry Mellon (1891-1962), married April 1914. She had two children, Charles and Sallie. Here's her grave: www.findagrave.com/cgi-bin/fg.cgi?page=gr&GRid=92338292 Ursula Wolcott Brown Twining (1891-1967) is also here: www.flickr.com/photos/library_of_congress/8345221665/ We had an earlier possible sighting of Miss Stillman here: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/library_of_congress/8191533938/]

comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: Getty Images has this picture, labeled as from 1913 at the wedding of Helen Miller Gould. www.gettyimages.com/detail/news-photo/wedding-of-helen-mi... However, NYT of Jan 23, 1913 select.nytimes.com/gst/abstract.html?res=F00811F8355E1373... reporting on the wedding the previous day makes no mention of adult attendants, only two young nieces of the bride. However, these four young ladies (possibly + one other) were to be attendants at the June 1913 wedding of Harriet Ferry to William Manice, according to NYT of May 25, 1913 select.nytimes.com/gst/abstract.html?res=F20811F93B5F1373... NYT of Jun 4, 1913 select.nytimes.com/gst/abstract.html?res=F20813F9345E1373... describes what the attendants wore and it matches this picture. See clip

comment.author: 35234565@N04
comment._content: Thanks to both swanq and pennylrichardsca for your excellent research. No doubt the colors must have been beautiful.  We'll add some of the information to the record the next time we update.
